comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Popular Mechanics, August 1915 books.google.com/books?id=l98DAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA253&l... shows what is presumably the same stand and possibly the same cop. If so, this copy has been annotated by hand to identify Officer Coggershall. archiver.rootsweb.ancestry.com/th/read/COGGESHALL/2010-04... suggests that he was Freeborn Coggeshall "Newport Daily News, 8 Aug 1950. Freeborn Coggeshall, 71, who retired 40 years ago as a patrolman after 40 years on the police force looks to the modern-day traffice stand as his greatest achievement. In 1912 he invented a stand that he believes was the first in the country. In 1915 members of the summer colony presented him with an umbrella to go over the stand. Newport Daily News, 29 May 1958: In Memoriam, Deceased members of the Newport Police Dept.: Freeborn Coggeshall, 26 Aug 1950.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks for your great research swanq. We'll add some of this information to the record the next time we update.
